_comment: 9max MP Opening Range - Raise or Fold Strategy
_note: When action is folded to MP, we play a raise or fold strategy.

explanations.AA: Premium pocket pair. Always raise from Hijack when folded to you.
explanations.KK: Premium pocket pair. Strong opening hand from Hijack.
explanations.QQ: Premium pocket pair. Clear raise from HJ position.
explanations.JJ: Strong pocket pair. Raise to build pot and gain information.
explanations.TT: Medium-high pocket pair. Profitable raise from HJ.
explanations.99: Medium pocket pair. Solid value from Hijack.
explanations.88: Medium pocket pair. Playable from HJ with position advantage.
explanations.77: Medium-low pocket pair. Raise for fold equity and set mining.
explanations.66: Small-medium pair. Raise for fold equity, flop sets profitably.
explanations.55: Small-medium pair. Playable from HJ with 3+ players behind.
explanations.44: Small pair. Raise to thin the field and realize equity.
explanations.33: Small pair. Can flop sets, raise to control pot size.
explanations.22: Smallest pair. Set mining value from Hijack position.
explanations.AKs: Premium suited broadway. Excellent opening hand from HJ.
explanations.AQs: Strong suited broadway. Great raise from Hijack.
explanations.AJs: Strong suited ace. Good postflop playability from HJ.
explanations.ATs: Suited wheel ace. Flush and straight potential.
explanations.A9s: Suited ace with gap. Playable from HJ with position.
explanations.A8s: Suited ace with gap. Reasonable from middle position.
explanations.A7s: Suited ace with wheel potential. Marginal but playable.
explanations.A6s: Suited wheel ace. Flush and wheel draw potential.
explanations.A5s: Suited wheel ace. Strong flush and wheel potential.
explanations.A4s: Suited wheel ace. Nut flush potential, wheel draws.
explanations.A3s: Suited wheel ace. Flush potential from HJ.
explanations.A2s: Suited wheel ace. Nut flush draw potential.
explanations.KQs: Suited broadway. Strong postflop playability from HJ.
explanations.KJs: Suited king-jack. Good straight and flush potential.
explanations.KTs: Suited king-ten. Bottom of KTx+ suited range from HJ.
explanations.K9s: Suited king with gap. Too weak from Hijack, fold.
explanations.QJs: Suited queen-jack. Good connectivity and flush potential.
explanations.QTs: Suited queen-ten. Bottom of QTx+ suited range from HJ.
explanations.Q9s: Suited queen with gap. Too weak from middle position, fold.
explanations.JTs: Premium suited connector. Excellent postflop playability.
explanations.J9s: One-gap suited connector. Reasonable from HJ with position.
explanations.J8s: Two-gap suited connector. Too weak from Hijack, fold.
explanations.T9s: Suited connector. Good straight and flush potential.
explanations.T8s: One-gap suited connector. Playable from HJ position.
explanations.T7s: Two-gap suited connector. Too weak from middle position, fold.
explanations.98s: Suited connector. Flops well with straight potential.
explanations.97s: One-gap suited connector. Too weak from Hijack, fold.
explanations.87s: Suited connector. Bottom of suited connector range from HJ.
explanations.86s: One-gap suited connector. Too weak from middle position, fold.
explanations.76s: Suited connector. Minimum suited connector from Hijack.
explanations.75s: One-gap suited connector. Too weak from Hijack, fold.
explanations.65s: Low suited connector. Too weak from middle position, fold.
explanations.54s: Low suited connector. Too weak from Hijack, fold.
explanations.43s: Low suited connector. Too weak from middle position, fold.
explanations.32s: Lowest suited connector. Always fold from Hijack.
explanations.AKo: Premium offsuit broadway. Always raise from Hijack.
explanations.AQo: Strong offsuit broadway. Clear raise from HJ position.
explanations.AJo: Offsuit ace-jack. Too easily dominated from Hijack, fold.
explanations.ATo: Offsuit ace-ten. Easily dominated, fold from middle position.
explanations.KQo: Offsuit broadway. Dominated by better aces, fold from HJ.
explanations.KJo: Offsuit king-jack. Too weak from middle position, fold.
explanations.QJo: Offsuit broadway. Too easily dominated from Hijack, fold.
explanations.JTo: Offsuit jack-ten. Too weak from middle position, fold.
explanations.T9o: Offsuit connector. No flush potential, fold from Hijack.
explanations.98o: Offsuit connector. Too weak from middle position, fold.
explanations.87o: Offsuit connector. Always fold from Hijack.
explanations.76o: Offsuit connector. Too weak from middle position, fold.
explanations.72o: Worst hand in poker. Always fold from any position.
